bullets.text: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s resignation narrows Republicans’ House majority, exposing MAGA fractures and complicating fiscal and Ukraine/Israel aid votes.
G20 leaders pushed back on Trump’s Ukraine peace plan, signaling continued backing for Kyiv and resistance to concessions that could reward Russian aggression.
IRS begins enforcing new reporting rules on DeFi, mixers, and self-custody, curbing a popular crypto tax dodge starting with 2025 filings.
Dovish-leaning remarks from NY Fed’s John Williams helped stabilize markets after volatility, reinforcing expectations for a gradual, data-dependent easing path.
Small caps’ multiyear underperformance persists; breadth remains narrow, though improving liquidity and expected rate cuts could catalyze mean reversion.
Texas’ rapid AI data center buildout strains ERCOT capacity, raising blackout risk during extreme cold and highlighting grid upgrade, demand-response, and siting needs.
China reports milestone breeding uranium from thorium, advancing fuel self-sufficiency and strategic flexibility for its nuclear program.
California regulators cleared Waymo’s expansion across the Bay Area and Southern California, signaling growing acceptance of robotaxis and potential scale economies.
Meta explores entering electricity trading, leveraging data center flexibility and AI forecasting—blurring lines between big tech and power markets.
Nasal nanodrops eradicated brain tumors in mice, suggesting a noninvasive delivery route that bypasses the blood-brain barrier for oncology.
Stem cell therapy restored vision in age-related macular degeneration patients, marking a clinically significant advance for retinal regeneration.
Activist Ananym Capital urges Baker Hughes to spin off oilfield services, arguing a breakup could unlock value and sharpen strategic focus.
